Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)

Definition.WordDefinition:
PUB
1. PUBlishing. A 1972 text-formatting language for {TOPS-10}, with syntax based on {SAIL}. Influenced {TeX} and {Scribe}. ["PUB: The Document Compiler", Larry Tesler, Stanford AI Proj Op Note, Sept 1972].
2. /pub, the top-level, publicly accessible directory on most {anonymous FTP} archives. This is usually where the interesting files are. See {pubic directory}.

Dictionary.Name: Virtual Entity of Relevant Acronyms (Version 1.9, June 2002)

Definition.WordDefinition: pub n : tavern consisting of a building with a bar and public rooms; often provides light meals [syn: {public house}, {saloon}, {pothouse}, {gin mill}, {taphouse}] [also: {pubbing}, {pubbed}]
